segment.source: Update a live tile from a background task
segment.target: Update a live tile from a background task

segment.source: Use a background task to update your app's live tile with fresh content.
segment.target: Use a background task to update your app's live tile with fresh content.

segment.source: Update a live tile from a background task
segment.target: Update a live tile from a background task

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: Important APIs
segment.target: Important APIs

segment.source: IBackgroundTask
segment.target: IBackgroundTask

segment.source: BackgroundTaskBuilder
segment.target: BackgroundTaskBuilder

segment.source: Use a background task to update your app's live tile with fresh content.
segment.target: Use a background task to update your app's live tile with fresh content.

segment.source: Here's a video that shows how to add live tiles to your apps.
segment.target: Here's a video that shows how to add live tiles to your apps.

segment.source: One Dev Minute - Updating a live tile from a background task
segment.target: One Dev Minute - Updating a live tile from a background task

segment.source: Create the background task project
segment.target: Create the background task project

segment.source: To enable a live tile for your app, add a new Windows Runtime Component project to your solution.
segment.target: To enable a live tile for your app, add a new Windows Runtime Component project to your solution.

segment.source: This is a separate assembly that the OS loads and runs in the background when a user installs your app.
segment.target: This is a separate assembly that the OS loads and runs in the background when a user installs your app.

segment.source: In Solution Explorer, right-click the solution, point to Add, and click or tap New Project.
segment.target: In Solution Explorer, right-click the solution, point to Add, and click or tap New Project.

segment.source: In the Add New Project dialog, select the Windows Runtime Component template in the Visual C# Windows Store section.
segment.target: In the Add New Project dialog, select the Windows Runtime Component template in the Visual C# Windows Store section.

segment.source: Name the project BackgroundTasks and click or tap OK.
segment.target: Name the project BackgroundTasks and click or tap OK.

segment.source: Microsoft Visual Studio adds the new project to the solution.
segment.target: Microsoft Visual Studio adds the new project to the solution.

segment.source: In the main project, add a reference to the BackgroundTasks project.
segment.target: In the main project, add a reference to the BackgroundTasks project.

segment.source: Implement the background task
segment.target: Implement the background task

segment.source: Implement the IBackgroundTask interface to create a class that updates your app's live tile.
segment.target: Implement the IBackgroundTask interface to create a class that updates your app's live tile.

segment.source: Your background work goes in the Run method.
segment.target: Your background work goes in the Run method.

segment.source: In this case, the task gets a syndication feed for the MSDN blogs.
segment.target: In this case, the task gets a syndication feed for the MSDN blogs.

segment.source: To prevent the task from closing prematurely while asynchronous code is still running, get a deferral.
segment.target: To prevent the task from closing prematurely while asynchronous code is still running, get a deferral.

segment.source: In Solution Explorer, rename the automatically generated file, Class1.cs, to BlogFeedBackgroundTask.cs.
segment.target: In Solution Explorer, rename the automatically generated file, Class1.cs, to BlogFeedBackgroundTask.cs.

segment.source: In BlogFeedBackgroundTask.cs, replace the automatically generated code with the stub code for the BlogFeedBackgroundTask class.
segment.target: In BlogFeedBackgroundTask.cs, replace the automatically generated code with the stub code for the BlogFeedBackgroundTask class.

segment.source: In the Run method implementation, add code for the GetMSDNBlogFeed and UpdateTile methods.
segment.target: In the Run method implementation, add code for the GetMSDNBlogFeed and UpdateTile methods.

segment.source: Set up the package manifest
segment.target: Set up the package manifest

segment.source: To set up the package manifest, open it and add a new background task declaration.
segment.target: To set up the package manifest, open it and add a new background task declaration.

segment.source: Set the entry point for the task to the class name, including its namespace.
segment.target: Set the entry point for the task to the class name, including its namespace.

segment.source: In Solution Explorer, open Package.appxmanifest.
segment.target: In Solution Explorer, open Package.appxmanifest.

segment.source: Click or tap the Declarations tab.
segment.target: Click or tap the Declarations tab.

segment.source: Under Available Declarations, select BackgroundTasks and click Add.
segment.target: Under Available Declarations, select BackgroundTasks and click Add.

segment.source: Visual Studio adds BackgroundTasks under Supported Declarations.
segment.target: Visual Studio adds BackgroundTasks under Supported Declarations.

segment.source: Under Supported task types, ensure that Timer is checked.
segment.target: Under Supported task types, ensure that Timer is checked.

segment.source: Under App settings, set the entry point to BackgroundTasks.BlogFeedBackgroundTask.
segment.target: Under App settings, set the entry point to BackgroundTasks.BlogFeedBackgroundTask.

segment.source: Click or tap the Application UI tab.
segment.target: Click or tap the Application UI tab.

segment.source: Set Lock screen notifications to Badge and Tile Text.
segment.target: Set Lock screen notifications to Badge and Tile Text.

segment.source: Set a path to a 24x24 pixel icon in the Badge logo field.
segment.target: Set a path to a 24x24 pixel icon in the Badge logo field.

segment.source: Important This icon must use monochrome and transparent pixels only.
segment.target: Important This icon must use monochrome and transparent pixels only.

segment.source: In the Small logo field, set a path to a 30x30 pixel icon.
segment.target: In the Small logo field, set a path to a 30x30 pixel icon.

segment.source: In the Wide logo field, set a path to a 310x150 pixel icon.
segment.target: In the Wide logo field, set a path to a 310x150 pixel icon.

segment.source: Register the background task
segment.target: Register the background task

segment.source: Create a BackgroundTaskBuilder to register your task.
segment.target: Create a BackgroundTaskBuilder to register your task.

segment.source: Note Starting in Windows 8.1, background task registration parameters are validated at the time of registration.
segment.target: Note Starting in Windows 8.1, background task registration parameters are validated at the time of registration.

segment.source: An error is returned if any of the registration parameters are invalid.
segment.target: An error is returned if any of the registration parameters are invalid.

segment.source: Your app must be able to handle scenarios where background task registration fails - for example, use a conditional statement to check for registration errors and then retry failed registration using different parameter values.
segment.target: Your app must be able to handle scenarios where background task registration fails - for example, use a conditional statement to check for registration errors and then retry failed registration using different parameter values.

segment.source: In your app's main page, add the RegisterBackgroundTask method and call it in the OnNavigatedTo event handler.
segment.target: In your app's main page, add the RegisterBackgroundTask method and call it in the OnNavigatedTo event handler.

segment.source: Debug the background task
segment.target: Debug the background task

segment.source: To debug the background task, set a breakpoint in the task’s Run method.
segment.target: To debug the background task, set a breakpoint in the task’s Run method.

segment.source: In the Debug Location toolbar, select your background task.
segment.target: In the Debug Location toolbar, select your background task.

segment.source: This causes the system to call the Run method immediately.
segment.target: This causes the system to call the Run method immediately.

segment.source: Set a breakpoint in the task’s Run method.
segment.target: Set a breakpoint in the task’s Run method.

segment.source: Press F5 or tap Debug Start Debugging to deploy and run the app.
segment.target: Press F5 or tap Debug Start Debugging to deploy and run the app.

segment.source: After the app launches, switch back to Visual Studio.
segment.target: After the app launches, switch back to Visual Studio.

segment.source: Ensure that the Debug Location toolbar is visible.
segment.target: Ensure that the Debug Location toolbar is visible.

segment.source: It's on the View Toolbars menu.
segment.target: It's on the View Toolbars menu.

segment.source: On the Debug Location toolbar, click the Suspend dropdown and select BlogFeedBackgroundTask.
segment.target: On the Debug Location toolbar, click the Suspend dropdown and select BlogFeedBackgroundTask.

segment.source: Visual Studio suspends execution at the breakpoint.
segment.target: Visual Studio suspends execution at the breakpoint.

segment.source: Press F5 or tap Debug Continue to continue running the app.
segment.target: Press F5 or tap Debug Continue to continue running the app.

segment.source: Press Shift+F5 or tap Debug Stop Debugging to stop debugging.
segment.target: Press Shift+F5 or tap Debug Stop Debugging to stop debugging.

segment.source: Return to the app's tile on the Start screen.
segment.target: Return to the app's tile on the Start screen.

segment.source: After a few seconds, tile notifications appear on your app's tile.
segment.target: After a few seconds, tile notifications appear on your app's tile.

segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: BackgroundTaskBuilder
